prompt:
Create a YouTube Short video (Vertical 9:16) titled "3 Secret Dog Meanings".

Target Audience: Dog owners. Total Duration: Less than 60 seconds. Voiceover: Energetic, fast-paced American Male. Pacing: Very fast cuts (every 2-3 seconds). Text Overlays: Use big, bold text in the center for the key facts.

Script and Visual Instructions:

[0:00-0:05] Hook Visuals: Fast montage: A dog spinning in circles, then a dog looking cute. Text Overlay: "3 WEIRD DOG SECRETS". Script: "Here are three things your dog does that seem weird, but actually have a secret meaning."

[0:05-0:20] Behavior 1: The Poop Compass Visuals: A dog spinning in circles on the grass. Text Overlay: "THE POOP COMPASS". Script: "Number one: The Spin. Why do they spin before they poop? Science says dogs prefer to align their bodies with the Earth's North-South magnetic axis. Yes, your dog is a furry compass."

[0:20-0:35] Behavior 2: The Lean Visuals: A dog sitting on a person's feet or leaning heavy against their leg. Text Overlay: "THE HUG". Script: "Number two: The Lean. If your dog sits on your feet or leans against you, they aren't trying to trip you. This is the dog version of a hug. They are saying, 'I feel safe with you.'"

[0:35-0:50] Behavior 3: Head Pressing (Warning) Visuals: A dog pressing its head firmly against a wall (use a serious/static image if possible). Text Overlay: "WARNING SIGN ⚠️". Script: "Number three is serious. If you see your dog pressing their head against a wall like this, it’s not cute. It can be a sign of toxic poisoning or brain damage. Get to a vet immediately."

[0:50-0:60] Outro Visuals: Happy dog running. Text Overlay: "Subscribe for more!". Script: "Does your dog do these? Subscribe for more animal secrets!"

prompt: can you create a video about 3 facts about golden retriever and use only golder retriver images and videos for this it should be a 1 minute video is it possible for you

timeline.visual_query: happy golden retriever running in slow motion, close up
timeline.script: Did you know these amazing facts about Golden Retrievers? Get ready to learn something new about these lovable dogs!

timeline.visual_query: golden retriever retrieving a duck from water, scottish landscape background
timeline.script: Originally bred in Scotland in the mid-19th century, Golden Retrievers were developed as exceptional gundogs. Their job was to retrieve waterfowl and game for hunters, even in harsh conditions and cold water.

timeline.visual_query: golden retriever gently holding an egg in its mouth, close up
timeline.script: They possess a remarkable 'soft mouth'—a trait carefully bred into them. This allows them to carry retrieved items, even delicate ones like an egg, without causing any damage. Their gentleness is truly legendary!

timeline.visual_query: golden retriever performing a trick, golden retriever as a service dog
timeline.script: Golden Retrievers are renowned for their high intelligence and eagerness to please. This makes them incredibly trainable, excelling in obedience, agility, and as invaluable service or therapy dogs.

timeline.visual_query: cute golden retriever puppy playing with a toy
timeline.script: Aren't Golden Retrievers just incredible? Share your favorite Golden fact in the comments below! Don't forget to like and subscribe!

timeline.visual_query: Golden Retriever dog running playful
timeline.script: Thinking about a Golden Retriever? Here are 3 amazing facts you NEED to know!

timeline.visual_query: Golden Retriever dog performing trick
timeline.script: Fact one: Golden Retrievers are incredibly intelligent, ranking among the top breeds for obedience and working intelligence.

timeline.visual_query: Golden Retriever dog gentle interaction
timeline.script: Fact two: Known for their gentle and friendly disposition, Goldens are excellent family pets and get along well with everyone!

timeline.visual_query: Golden Retriever dog retrieving soft toy
timeline.script: Fact three: Their original purpose was to retrieve downed fowl with a 'soft mouth,' meaning they can carry objects without damaging them, even a raw egg!

timeline.visual_query: Golden Retriever dog happy close up
timeline.script: Goldens truly are golden! Like and follow for more amazing dog facts!

prompt: can you create a video about a youtube short video about why dogs swings their tales when they see their loved once

timeline.visual_query: dog wagging tail excitedly
timeline.script: Ever notice your dog's tail go wild when they see you?

timeline.visual_query: dog looking alert happy
timeline.script: It's not just pure happiness! Tail wags are a complex form of dog communication.

timeline.visual_query: dog wagging tail close up
timeline.script: A wag, especially to the right, often signals positive feelings and approachability.

timeline.visual_query: dog excitedly greeting owner
timeline.script: When they see their loved ones, this specific wag communicates affection and excitement.

timeline.visual_query: dog happy calm looking at camera
timeline.script: Their brain releases oxytocin, the 'love hormone,' which fuels that joyful, rapid wag!

timeline.visual_query: dog happy panting smiling
timeline.script: It's their adorable way of saying: 'I missed you, and I'm SO happy you're here!'

prompt: can you generate a video shorts video and it should go viral the content should be why belgium malinois is not a good breed for first time dog owners

timeline.visual_query: Belgian Malinois dog intense stare
timeline.script: Thinking about a Belgian Malinois for your first dog?

timeline.visual_query: Belgian Malinois dog running fast
timeline.script: These aren't your average couch potatoes. They're built for action!

timeline.visual_query: Belgian Malinois dog focused training
timeline.script: They have an intense working drive that needs a constant outlet.

timeline.visual_query: Belgian Malinois dog obedience training
timeline.script: Requires expert-level training, not just basic commands. You need to be a leader!

timeline.visual_query: Belgian Malinois dog doing puzzle toy
timeline.script: Without mental stimulation, they'll invent their own 'job'—which often means destruction.

timeline.visual_query: Belgian Malinois dog alert posture
timeline.script: They're not just pets; they're partners requiring serious commitment and consistent boundaries.

timeline.visual_query: Belgian Malinois dog handler training
timeline.script: For first-time owners? You might be in over your head. This breed demands experience!

timeline.visual_query: Golden Retriever dog playing calmly
timeline.script: Consider a calmer, more forgiving breed first. Malinois demand mastery!
